questions.text: A person working In the smelting industry noticed the following changes in the nails. Finding can be seen in chronic poisoning with which of the following?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Arsenic and Thallium The image shows transverse white lines of 1 to 2mm in breadth across the nail which is called Aldrich- Mees lines and is usually seen in chronic arsenic and thallium poisoning.

questions.text: What type of skull fracture is shown in the given image?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Gutter fracture The given image shows a gutter fracture of the skull as part of the outer table is missing. Gutter fractures form a furrow in the outer table of the skull, usually as a result of a glancing blow by a missile from a rifled firearm. They may also be associated with comminuted depressed fractures of inner table of the skull.

questions.text: A man is under suspicion of smuggling cocaine in his body at the local airport. He is asymptomatic and an X-ray of the abdomen was done and is shown below. The next best step in the management of this case would be:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Institute whole-bowel irrigation The given scenario with an X-ray showing multiple cylindrical capsules (marked as *) in the stomach and intestine is consistent with body packing. The next best step in the management of this case would be to initiate whole-bowel irrigation.

questions.text: A bruise on the upper arm of an alleged victim of the assault has the following appearance. What is the age of the injury based on colour of this bruise?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) 7-12 days old The bruise in the given image has a yellow appearance which is attributed to the presence of bilirubin. This finding makes the bruise about 7-12 days old.

questions.text: The following postmortem finding is noted on a dead body. This finding is most prominent after how many hours of death?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) 36-48 hours The given picture shows postmortem marbling. It starts in 24 hours and becomes prominent in 36-48 hours. The blood in the vessels is haemolysed, which stains the vessel walls and the adjacent tissues, giving rise to a marbled appearance. It is greenish-brown or purplish-red discoloration of superficial veins due to the formation of sulphmethemoglobin which diffuses into tissues. It is distinctly appreciable on the abdomen, shoulders, chest, and inguinal region.

questions.text: An 89-year-old woman was seen dead at home. Her bloodstained clothes were sent for examination to your forensic laboratory. On adding a reagent, feathery crystals of hemochromogen arranged in clusters appeared in 5 minutes. What is the test done?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Takayama test The test done in the above scenario is the Takayama test. The Takayama test or hemochromogen crystal test is a microchemical test used to detect bloodstains. The stain used is Takayama reagent. If bloodstain is present, pink feathery crystals of hemochromogen or reduced alkaline hematin appear in a few minutes. The test is negative if the crystals are not formed in 30 minutes. This test is more reliable and gives positive results with old stains.

questions.text: The color of urine In a 27-year-old girl who ingested some unknown poison is given in the image below. Which of the following is likely to have been ingested by her?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Carbolic acid The given image shows olive green colored urine which is known as carboluria. It is seen after ingestion of carbolic acid. In carbolic acid poisoning, if the patient survives for 48 hrs, there will be carboluria followed by anuria. Carboluria is due to oxidation of hydroquinone and pyrecatechol on exposure to air.

questions.text: A 15-year-old boy presents with an injury from being tackled during a football match. As the Casualty medical officer, you would document the wound description in the case sheet as:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Laceration The given image shows a laceration. A laceration is a tear or a split in the skin, mucous membrane, muscle, or any internal organ, with a depth spanning more than the covering epithelium of the skin or an organ, and is produced by blunt force.

questions.text: The body of a missing individual was discovered bound in a boat. During the autopsy, you observe an organism in the brain tissue. Which of the following options is not a potential explanation for this finding?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Postmortem drowning The given image shows a diatom. Postmortem drowning does not show diatoms in the brain tissue. Diatoms are microscopic unicellular or colonial algae present in water. As the diatoms are found in both seawater and freshwater, their presence cannot differentiate between freshwater and seawater drowning.

questions.text: A 27-year-old male is being evaluated for longstanding anemia. On clinical examination, you notice the given finding. Which of the following metal poisoning is associated with this characteristic finding?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Lead The image is showing characteristic Burtonian lines, which are seen in lead poisoning and mercury poisoning. These are bluish-grey gingival lead lines that occur with chronic exposure to lead poisoning.

questions.text: A 5-year-old child with a history of perianal pain is brought to the OPD. On subjecting the specimen from the perianal region to a test, it produces yellow rhombic.crystals of spermine picrate. What is the test done?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Barberio test The test done in the scenario is the Barberio test. It is used to detect seminal fluid. When saturated aqueous or alcoholic solution of picric acid is added to the spermatic fluid, yellow needle-shaped rhombic crystals of spermine picrate are produced.

questions.text: Identify the given plant.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Argemone mexicana The given plant is Argemone mexicana. The flowers are yellow in color. All parts of the plant are poisonous. Oil extracted from argemone seeds is commonly used as an adulterant in mustard oil. Sanguinarine and dihydrosanguinarine are the toxic alkaloids present in the oil and it causes epidemic dropsy.

questions.text: Identify the injury shown in the given image
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) The image shows a horizontal, well-defined, circumferential mark around the neck, which is characteristic of a ligature mark. Ligature marks are typically seen in cases of ligature strangulation or hanging and result from sustained pressure applied by a rope, wire, or similar material. The mark in the image is dry, brownish, and parchment-like in appearance, which is classic for a ligature mark after some time has passed. It is positioned above the level of the thyroid cartilage, a common location for such injuries. The pattern and depth of the mark can vary depending on the material used, duration of pressure, and force applied. Unlike graze, imprint, or pressure abrasions, ligature marks are circumferential and often associated with underlying soft tissue damage, helping to distinguish them in forensic examinations. Therefore, the most appropriate diagnosis for the injury in the image is a ligature mark.

questions.text: The method of identification used in forensic lab as shown in the image below is based on:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Impressions of sweat pores Poroscopy is a method of personal identification through the comparison of the impressions of sweat pores (present on friction ridges of palmar and plantar surfaces).

questions.text: Fracture through the line shown in the image is called as?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Motorcyclist's fracture The line shown in the given image corresponds closely to the location of a hinge fracture of the base of the skull, also called a motorcyclist's fracture.

questions.text: A body was brought in for post-mortem examination, and the following can be seen. What type of wounds are these?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Defense wounds The given image shows irregular and ragged cut wounds over the palmar surface of the hands and fingers, which is suggestive of defense wounds. Defense wounds are the wounds that occur as a result of the victimâ€™s attempt to save himself from an injury

questions.text: Identify the plant shown below
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Cerebra Thevetia The plant shown above is the Cerebra Thevetia. Thevetin is a cardiac poison derived from the plant Cerebra Thevetia (yellow oleander). All parts of the plant are poisonous. Symptoms of intoxication are characterized by vomiting, diarrhea, headache, dizziness, mydriasis, and loss of muscular power. Cardiovascular signs include a weak and irregular pulse rate with hypotension. Possible complications are heart block and cardiorespiratory failure.

questions.text: A male was brought with the following injury in a gunshot incident. What is the possible range from which the weapon inflicted injury?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Contact shot In the given scenario, based on the stellate-shaped wound seen, it seems to be a contact shot entry wound. A contact shot entry wound on the skull typically has a stellate shape due to high-energy impact.

questions.text: Identify the lesion shown in the image below.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) The image depicts a wound with linear splitting of the tissue, sharp margins, and crushed hair follicles, which is suggestive of an incised-looking lacerated wound. Incised-looking lacerated wounds are seen at sites where the skin overlies an area of the bone where there is scanty underlying subcutaneous tissue. A blunt force causes linear splitting of the tissue which results in the laceration resembling an incised wound. There will be extensive tissue crushing but the margins will be clear and delineable.

choices.text: Case of suspension/hanging more than 72 hours
Case of immersion in water for 36 hours
Case of colliquative liquefaction due to immersion in hot water

questions.text: The below phenomenon is due to:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) The image shows maceration of the soles, indicative of washerwoman's skin, occurring after 36 hours of immersion in water. This condition appears on areas with a keratin layer, starting with the fingertips and palms before affecting the soles. Initial signs include wrinkling, paleness, and sogginess, with fingerpads being the first affected.
